content:
You need a password to login to your account on your email provider's server. Thunderbird is just passing on the password you type to the server.

What error message do you get?

Can you login to your account via webmail?
creator: christ1

content: Would you please post a screenshot of the screen asking for <your login>? That may help. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Is your photo an attachment to a message you have received? In that case you can right-click the attachment at the bottom bar of the message window - Save As.
creator: christ1

content: Maybe if you post the complete error message, plus screenshots of incoming server setting and SMTP server settings, we may have suggestions. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Yes, that should do it. Be sure thunderbird is not running during that copy.

content: You need t allow cookies in Thunderbird for the OAuth authentication process to work. https://support.mozilla.org/kb/automatic-conversion-google-mail-accounts-oauth20

content: Se pensi sia legato all'aggiornamento, qui puoi trovare le precedenti release -> https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/ Al momento però nel forum non ci sono altre segnalazioni come la tua per cui non sarei certo che il problema sia la 115.10.1
creator: @next

content: See the little icon to the right of the 'quick filter' button in your screenshot? Click that and select 'table view'

content: That is sometimes an error in the SMTP server configuration. If you post a screenshot of the SMTP settings, some suggestions may be offered. Thank you.

content: Devi chiedere a chi te lo ha venduto. Questo forum riguarda solo i prodotti Mozilla (Firefox e Thunderbird).

content: Synaptic does not yet show 115.10.1 -- is there a way to get it before it shows up in the available program versions? Thx.
creator: gandsnut

content: That release just came out yesterday, so it may be available shortly. I am a Linux novice with no awareness of the mechanics of Synaptic. Sorry.
creator: davidsk

content:
@David: In the course of updating my package manager Synaptic / apt, I saw the 115.10.1 release, and installed it. With caution I say this resolved the lock-up at exit problem, but I won't mark this solved for a few days, to see things are kewl.

Much appreciated.
creator: gandsnut

content: Edit: I should have said "sometimes." Sometimes it deletes correctly, at other times it doesn't. I can't see a pattern.
creator: mossy_rock

content: It may be that the prefs.js file is not being saved at termination. That might be an antivirus interruption or other issue preventing proper shutdown. This may not be the problem, but it seems to be a possibility.
creator: davidsk

content: Look in account settings to see which folder that Thunderbird is viewing. You have four, which generally indicates there have been problems in the past.
creator: davidsk

content: @david Well, all that Message Storage tells me is that the Local Directory is ...\inbound.att.net What to do next? Rename the folder as something else and hope that it goes to the next folder??
